author: Dayne Putnam
comment: The app is by far the best Nest widget I've used yet with a creative pop-up panel to adjust temp and whatnot.  I can't adjust where each individual element goes, but the Dev said that's something he'll work on in the future. The Dev is fast to reply, which is always amazing to see.  Development has been a little slow for a bit now is the only reason for 4 star.

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Support for Android Nougat up to 7.1.1 has been added

author: Joe Callahan
comment: I paid for this app. Didn't work with Oreo when I got my new Pixel 2 XL. I contacted the dev and he told me it should be compatible with Oreo by the end of the following week. Except that was 3 months ago and he no longer responds to emails. Now I have an app that I paid for and I can not use any more. What a waste. Very disappointing.

author: Raymond Crott
comment: Works ok, but the excessive battery draining is real showstopper. To bad, because normal battery usage would lift this app all the competition far behind

author: Denise Norris
comment: Stopped recognizing thermostat.  Tried dropping and adding account, but no thermostat.  Same after clearing data/cache.

author: Will Dereski
comment: Love all the features except when I add the widget shortcut and use it to toggle away/home, the away says 0 when it's actually 16.5.  Also very hard on the battery.

author: Sam Vanderstraeten
comment: Integration with Tasker does not work. Developer does not respond to questions about this.

author: Jason Barker
comment: Works well, but drains the battery. Interface could use some updating.

author: Jim Strompolis
comment: Dev is not fixing battery drain. Thermostat functionality works. Very unattractive interface. The popup design needs to be updated to material design. It looks very dated and stands out when compared with other apps. This app destroys my battery when it uses GPS for geofencing. A single app consuming nearly 500 mAh of battery in an 8 hour period is not acceptable.
title: No improvement - moving on

author: Jason Silva
comment: When nest goes into auto away, would it be possible to make the widget disable auto away when we hit the up or down temperature buttons. Instead of having to manually turn off auto away and then hit up or down. Why not make a macro instead of just saying that we cant touch the temp while in auto away?

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content:
Hi Jason

Please contact me so I know what exactly is happening. When the thermostat is in away mode there's not much you can do.  No?

author: Jim Weaver
comment: I purchased this app for my Samsung Gear S2 Classic and it may be my ignorance but do all android wearables and Android apps work with each other? If they do,  I can't get the calida app to open under the wearable tab b/c it's greyed out,  the widget works great but I wanted this for my watch. ..can you help? Will update review upon clarification,  thanks!  Received an update about supporting the Gear S2, not supported, ; (

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Hi Jim. Calida is supported on Android wear devices only, but not on Tizen devices such as the Gear 2. Potentially support for tizen might be implemented in the future. Get in touch if you need more details.

title: Great widget but...

author: Steven Atherton
comment: When I use "set variable", the tasker plugin doesn't seem to return any data from the thermostat. If I set a tasker variable with data from the calida plugin, the tasker variable gets set to something like "%awaystate" rather than the data from the thermostat. Hope that makes sense
title: Tasker integration doesn't fully work

author: Sudarshan Krishnakumar
comment: It simply doesn't show up the images to select for setting background image.. Please fix this!
title: Its ok, but I can't set background image for theming

author: Joshua Timothy
comment: This app is amazing and very well made. It has so much functionality to monitor and control your nest thermostat and supports automation. I currently am using it to control my own zooper widget with tasker integration.
title: This app is perfect!

author: Haden Cruickshank
comment: Just installed marshmallow and it won't open, no widget and then periodic crash notifications until I uninstalled it.. shame!
title: Crashes on Marshmallow

author: Mark Murrin
comment: Overall the app is working great on my one phone.. but when you try to install it on a second phone with a family account, the thermostat doesnt show up.. not sure what i may be missing with that.  Goal was to have two phones active and set away/home triggers for each and if one phone is home while the other leaves it remains in home mode.

author: Paul Janney
comment: Wear app reports no connection. Have to open phone app, then wear app will work for a while. Galaxy s6 and moto 360 v2. Thankfully nest has finally added wear support so I can forge calinda
title: Wear app has no connection

author: Stephanie Lindsey
comment: I love this app but it's killing my battery. It seems to be gps related. Can we get an option to disable gps during certain days/hours?
title: Battery usage

author: Konstantin Rudoy
comment: Not compatible with my device (NVIDA Shield K1, Android 7.0)

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Support for Android Nougat up to 7.1.1 has been added

author: Zhelyan Panchev
comment: I drive home and cross the geofence (set to max) in 3 mins, not enough time for Nest to heat up the house
title: Bigger geofence

author: Douglas Keller
comment: I mainly downloaded it hoping it would integrate well with Tasker. Seamless. I am very happy with this app. Keep up the great work.
title: It does exactly what I need it to do.

author: george triolet
comment: Great for Android Wear, can we get support for Samsung Tizen smart watches? Thanks
title: Tizen support

author: Kim Steele
comment: Any word on Nougat compatibility?

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Support for Android Nougat up to 7.1.1 has been added

author: Gerald Gillespie
comment: I have two homes. Two widgets. Always got an hvac error when using second widget but can control it fine in nest. Developer contacts me directly and explains situation but also accommodates me in another way.  Turns out nest is less forgiving in api than in their own app.  Very happy to understand problem and how to use calida to deal with it. Keep up good work!

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: This is caused by a limitation imposed by Nest labs. After an hour the Nest server will again accept commands.  This will not happen under normal use. Please get in touch if you need more info information.

title: Developer is very helpful. App is great

author: Sun Yi
comment: A few bug has been corrected by dev upon reporting almost immediately. Really responsive developer.

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Hi Sun, version 2.7.6 has been published. Thanks for your patience.

title: This works.

author: Nicholas Cannon
comment: Please add history tracking and more info options in status bar.

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Hi Nicholas, I have posted version 2.7.4 which should fix this issue.

title: Best for Nest

author: Jared McKinley
comment: Really liking this widget. Makes all of the nest functions available from my home screen. Now I have all my wink shortcuts and nest widget on one page of my launcher. Thanks!
title: Works great!

author: Brent Graham
comment: Had some issues but the developer fixed them immediately. Very responsive dev. So far the app seems to be exactly what my nests have been missing, proper geofencing controls. The fact that the dev cares and communicates on this app is icing on the cake.

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Brent, this is a Marshmallow issue which is now fixed in version 2.7.2. It seems that Marshmallow is still dealing with some UI issues here and there.

title: Necessary Nest Essential

author: Matthew Britten
comment: Fantastic support, great app!

author: Chris Shim
comment: This is a great Widget and app for Android Wear. On wear especially, it's more responsive and reliable than the other apps I tried. The only issue I have with it is that you can't pull the data into Tasker on the fly, you have to create a profile that has to be triggered for the variables to pass into Tasker. Smart Thermostat Plugin is much better for use with Tasker tasks, but doesn't include the widget or wear app. For the time being I guess I have to keep both.
title: Great Widget and Wear App

author: Rick Benham
comment: Beautiful on Android wear. Horrible widget on phone tho. But hey. I only got it for the wear support anyway so I'm happy.
title: Great for wear. Ugly on phone.

author: Mathew Adamson
comment: Easily the best third party app for a smart device I've ever used. Great job,  keep up the great updates.
title: Wow

author: Doug Pickthall
comment: I've been using this app for about a month and have found it simple and thorough for controlling my Nest. Thank you
title: Well done

author: Douglas Barmore Jr
comment: Love it, but it sucks the crap out of my battery...

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: The additional battery usage is caused by the GPS processing when a GPS fence rule is in use. This is fairly normal for GPS use but I will add an option to decrease the GPS usage.

title: Love it but

author: Tom Zimmerman
comment: This is the widget that should have been made by Nest. You can see and adjust temperature from the home screen. I was off put by the price but the reviews seemed good and I had extra money on my account. I do wish to be able to change text color or have text color change as the background would. This would so I could stop using the background and still know what is going on.

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content:
Hi Tom. Feature will he added in the next release.

Thanks.

title: Great widget

author: Calvin Mane
comment: 5 STARS!! I thought the developer programed this app to perfection. It was the only app worth buying for me ever!!! I have owned androids for most of my life, and i have always thought majority of the paid apps in the playstore is not worth actually paying for... Til Now! I have this widget displayed on my homescreen Tablet along with widgets that controls my lights and wifi cameras in the house. Boom!! I just made myself a DIY Home Control touch screen Relay Switch!

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: Hey Kevin. Thanks for the great review. That makes the long hours spent all the more worthed. Jo.

title: Great app

author: beermanuk
comment: I'd be happy to pay for this app. Haven't been in the nest app since I installed this.
title: A better app than Google created.

comment: A great app, with a top rate developer.
title: Brilliant

author: Bob Baker
comment: I initially had a lot of issues with the app on my Moto 360 - it kept telling me there were no thermostats detected even though I had mine one up on my Nexus 6.  My initial review was not very good, and the developer contacted me to see if they could help.  After sending requested information to help troubleshoot, the issue was quickly discovered and an update to the app published within a couple of hours.  The issue has now been resolved and I couldn't be happier.  I am anxious to explore the functionality Calida provides the official Nest app does not.  The developer deserves a lot of credit for being so responsive, patient and willing to help.

reply.author: PromaSoft
reply.content: The issue has been fixed in version 2.5.7

author: Alejandro Gonzalez
comment: This application does every thing I need it to do with my Nest.  Also the developer is excellent and has great communication.
title: Simply Awesome App

author: Brandon Pries
comment: This is a 'must have' for Nest owners. Developer is consistently improving app and adding more functionality. He quickly implemented suggestion I had. Highly recommended!
title: Great Widget!
